meanings.definition: To type or set in type before the final version.
meanings.sent1: I always pretype my essays before writing the final draft.
meanings.sent2: She pretyped the report to ensure there were no errors before printing.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to pretype his speech in invisible ink for a fun twist.
meanings.sent4: The idea pretyped in her mind, waiting to be brought to life on paper.
meanings.sent5: Pretyping the email in advance saved her a lot of time later on.

meanings.definition: A preliminary or initial version of a document or text.
meanings.sent1: The pretype of the article needed some revisions before publication.
meanings.sent2: He shared the pretype of the novel with a few trusted friends for feedback.
meanings.sent3: The pretype of the menu accidentally got mixed up with the final version.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was filled with pretypes of poems waiting to be perfected.
meanings.sent5: The pretype of the contract was missing some crucial details.
